summary:
Throughout my career to date, I have cultivated a reputation for innovation as a forward-thinking leader in several areas, including Product Management, R&D, and Electronics Engineering. I have spent the last 4+ years defining product strategy and designing roadmaps to enable software, firmware, and app development for wearable devices. Prior roles involved intensive research and development of sensors and biomedical devices utilizing electronics engineering skills. I am a talented and influential product evangelist with a unique ability to combine technology and commercial acumen and drive all phases of the product development lifecycle utilizing evidence-based management principles.

I am an ambitious and growth-focused professional with entrepreneurial flair and dedication to exceeding expectations. I am flexible and adaptable to working in dynamic and multi-disciplinary environments across a range of projects (academic and industry-based), utilizing strong teamwork skills and dedication to continuous improvement.

I possess a comprehensive understanding of technology, science, IoT, wearable devices, embedded systems, AI, SaaS, emerging trends, IP development, and startup activities. As a collaborative communicator with bilingual proficiency in Italian and English, I can foster relationships and liaise effectively with multi-disciplinary stakeholders. My dedication, work ethic, and history of achievement make me a valuable addition to any organization.

Wearable band for hand gesture recognition based on strain sensors
accomplishment_publications.description: A novel fully wearable system based on a smart wristband equipped with stretchable strain gauge sensors and readout electronics have been assembled and tested to detect a set of movements of a hand crucial in rehabilitation procedures. The high sensitivity of the active devices embedded on the wristband do not need a direct contact with the skin, thus maximizing the comfort on the arm of the tester. The gestures done with the device have been auto-labeled by comparing the signals detected in real-time by the sensors with a commercial infrared device (Leap motion). Finally, the system has been evaluated with two machine-learning algorithms Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) and Support Vector Machine (SVM), reaching a reproducibility of 98%% and 94%%, respectively.

recommendations: As Executive-in-Residence for Movit, I appreciated working with Andrea on all aspects of launching a start up. He impressed me with his ability to cheerfully embrace both complex technical problems and complex human problems. He is curious and open to new learning.

I have known Andrea for a very long time, and the qualities that he has shown, since his early years, are surely his tenacity, persistence, honesty and determination. He is a hard worker and is very dependable.  With time, he has acquired the capability to communicate with poise and unwavering professionalism.  He is definitely an asset to any organization or company.

Andrea and I worked together on many projects at both Menrva Research Group and Movit Technologies. In such a fast-paced research environment where resources were limited, we had to be creative with our problem-solving and our planning. His strong leadership skills, accompanied with his diverse technical background, proved to be extremely efficient in solving a multitude of complex problems we encountered. One of his strongest attributes is his ability to dive through patents and research papers to gain a sense of context in what is readily available for the problem-at-hand.

Andrea was my project manager for around 7 months and he did a great job helping to prioritize and distribute tasks among members of our team. Keeping the bigger picture in view was critical to timely achievement of our goals in the limited time-frame we had, and Andrea did a great job keeping us focused on what mattered. His strong engineering background made discussing technical details with him engaging and productive (in contrast to a typical manager/engineer dynamic).

Andrea is a powerful team leader and an extremely knowledgeable engineer. He has a multitude of experiences several industries (biomedical, material science, wearables, and electronics) and brings a very unique and powerful range of experiences to any problem he tackles. He has managed teams and guided them to solve complex problems. He is continuously learning and applying agile and scrum methodologies to maximize team productivity and efficiency. He is a highly recommended addition to any team.
